description.title: gearbox assembly: precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: gearbox assembly: precautions for the repair

introduction.para: All information contained in these manuals is intended exclusively for automotive industry professionals.
Since this documentation is intended to cover the whole range, throughout the world, it does not include equipment designed for use in specific countries.
The procedures and fault finding procedures recommended and described in this manual have been designed by automotive industry repair professionals.

noteR.para: Before carrying out any operation on a vehicle fitted with the Stop & Start system, always follow the safety instructionsvehicle: precautions for the repairGIEMR-002446

descbody.para: This method provides information which will allow you to:

ul.li: acquire proper understanding of the component on which you will be working,
benefit from the best conditions in which to carry out the repair,
ensure that the component operates as well as possible, meeting customer requirements
optimise component repair time
work in the best safety conditions.

descbody.para: Please take the time to read this procedure as it will help you to save time when carrying out repairs.
Observe the basic principles concerning vehicle repairs
The quality of the repair depends first and foremost on how much care is exercised by the person carrying out the repair.
Carry out the operation on the component in a clean working area.

ul.li: use the recommended consumables vehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445,
use the recommended tools,
observe the tightening torques,
observe the recommendations for parts that should always be replaced after removal
clean and degrease the areas to be bonded, to ensure they bond correctly

noteR.para: To ensure proper sealing, the joint faces must be clean, dry and free from greas (avoid any fingerprints)
Do not scrape the joint faces of the aluminium: any damage caused to the joint face increases the risk of leaking.

descbody.para: Use professional products and apply them with care (e.g. do not apply excessive sealing paste to the sealing surface, in order to prevent damage to the component).

noteR.para: Applying excess sealant could cause it to be squeezed out when parts are tightened. Mixing sealant and fluid may cause damage to some components.

descbody.para: Observe the chronological order of the steps:

ul.li: remove the component,
clean the component before repairing,
remove the part(s) concerned
check the part(s) removed,
replace the faulty part(s) with new part(s),
perform the necessary adjustments and/or calibrations so that the component operates correctly,
observe the tightening torques.

noteR.para: To prevent any contamination of components and to ensure the quality of the repair, it is strictly forbidden to re-use drained gearbox oil.
Ensure that the parts removed match and ensure that they are refitted in the correct order.

descbody.para: Use suitable tools which are in good condition (avoid the use of multi-purpose tools such as adjustable pliers).
To ensure the good quality of repairs and safe working conditions, use only special tooling.
Certain devices and parts must be handled with particular attention to safety and cleanliness and, above all, with due care.
The safety symbol used in this manual indicates that special attention must be paid to the procedure or the tightening torque values.

ul.li: use personal protection (gloves, goggles, work shoes, masks, skin protection, etc.),
check that the working area is clean and tidy during the operation,
use supports and adopt a correct posture when performing heavy work or raising loads,
use suitable tools which are in good condition (use of multi-purpose tools such as adjustable pliers etc. should be avoided).
Do not put yourself in danger by hurrying or taking risks,
do not use harmful products in unventilated rooms,
always follow the safety instructions associated with the operation to be performed,
do not ingest any chemicals (brake fluid, coolant, etc.).
do not smoke when working on vehicles,
sort waste according to its particular qualities,
do not burn discarded products (tyres, etc.).

descbody.para: Respecting the recommended methods will guarantee the best performance and reliability of the component.
